What do you notice? If you make a claim, tell us what you noticed that supports your claim.
We notice that the use of fossil fuels is consistent, while clean energy is increasing. We also notice that the use of overall energy use has increased over time as well.  Moreover, China and the United States have a large portion of their energy coming from clean sources while India basically gets all their energy from fossil fuels.

What do you wonder? What are you curious about that comes from what you notice in the graphs? 
Why is China using more energy compared to India when both of these countries have a very similar population size is it because China is still a developing country?

What impact does this topic have on you and your community?
This topic impacts our community because it emphasizes the importance of clean renewable energy. By looking at the graphs we can say that the globe is moving towards clean energy, although fossil fuels seem to be the main source of energy. This is important because it suggests that we are working to combat global issues such as climate change. Furthermore, it will encourage people to be thoughtful about their carbon footprint.
On the graph,  US reliance on fossil fuels decreases as the years go by.  As US citizens this could indicate a change in how we source energy as well as utilize energy, influencing our way of life.
